docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, Dec. 8 -- On the eve of the decisive General Assembly debate on the proposed internationalization of Jerusalem, Israel gave flat warning today to the United Nations that any effort to put the city under the aegis of the world...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, Dec. 8 -- On the eve of the decisive General Assembly debate on the proposed internationalization of Jerusalem, Israel gave flat warning today to the United Nations that any effort to put the city under the aegis of the world organization would be taken at considerable risk.
docs.abstract: budget com approves $8.15 million over Israel warning

headline.main: ISRAEL WARNS U. N. ON JERUSALEM AIM; Says Any Attempt to Put City Under World Organization Would Be at Great Risk

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: A five-power resolution calling on all nations to respect the territorial integrity of China was approved yesterday morning by an overwhelming majority of the United Nations General Assembly.
docs.lead_paragraph: A five-power resolution calling on all nations to respect the territorial integrity of China was approved yesterday morning by an overwhelming majority of the United Nations General Assembly.
docs.abstract: 5-power resolution asking nations to respect China territorial integrity passed by Assembly, 45-5; Little Assembly to keep charges against USSR under continuous study

headline.main: U. N. Assembly Asks Nations To Respect China's Integrity; U. N. ASKS NATIONS TO RESPECT CHINA

docs.snippet: The United Nations General Assembly adopted a resolution last night reaffirming its decision of two years ago that the Jerusalem area should be administered by the Trusteeship Council.
docs.lead_paragraph: The United Nations General Assembly adopted a resolution last night reaffirming its decision of two years ago that the Jerusalem area should be administered by the Trusteeship Council.
docs.abstract: Assembly approves plan, 38-14 with 7 abstentions; Malik leads fight against delay; no recommendations made for implementation; most provisions of '47 plan repeated; text of Uruguayan-Danish proposal to defer vote

headline.main: U. N. VOTE PLACES TRUSTEESHIP UNIT OVER JERUSALEM; Assembly Reaffirms Decision Adopted Two Years Ago -Tally Is 38-14,7 Abstaining

docs.lead_paragraph: Following is a summary of the major decisions taken at the fourth regular session of the United Nations General Assembly:
docs.abstract: summary of UN Assembly major decisions on various issues

headline.main: Major Decisions Adopted at U.N. General Assembly Session; Major Decisions of the U.N. Assembly

docs.snippet: The fourth regular session of the United Nations General Assembly, after more than 540 plenary and committee meetings, yesterday completed its work. For eighty days of the session the Assembly had been dominated by the familiar East-West debates and...
docs.lead_paragraph: The fourth regular session of the United Nations General Assembly, after more than 540 plenary and committee meetings, yesterday completed its work. For eighty days of the session the Assembly had been dominated by the familiar East-West debates and accusations -- and few hard decisions had been taken.

docs.snippet: TO assist the motorist crossing frontiers, France is establishing a series of border gateways. The first Porte de France will be ready for operation in April, according to G. Poguet, Chief of the Tourism Section of the Automobile Club of France, and...
docs.lead_paragraph: TO assist the motorist crossing frontiers, France is establishing a series of border gateways. The first Porte de France will be ready for operation in April, according to G. Poguet, Chief of the Tourism Section of the Automobile Club of France, and originator of the gateway system.
docs.abstract: France to set up border gateways to aid motorists crossing frontiers

headline.main: NEWS NOTES FROM THE FIELD OF TRAVEL

docs.snippet: PARIS, Dec. 11 -- Expert opinion in this European capital of the Marshall Plan is that the projected trade bloc of France, Italy, Belgium, the Netherlands and Luxembourg will not achieve a great deal toward freeing trade within Europe, and that the...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Dec. 11 -- Expert opinion in this European capital of the Marshall Plan is that the projected trade bloc of France, Italy, Belgium, the Netherlands and Luxembourg will not achieve a great deal toward freeing trade within Europe, and that the proposed closer linking of Britain with Scandinavia will achieve still less.
docs.abstract: experts in Paris stress need for easing of debt burden expressed in blocked sterling, held in London, to allow convertibility

headline.main: Easing Britain's Debt Burden Held Way to Liberate Trade; European Experts Say She Cannot Return to Convertibility While $900,000,000 a Year Is Drained From Her

docs.snippet: Almost all of the interest in the foreign exchange market last week centered in the slowly ebbing value of the Canadian free dollar which on Friday sold down to 87.82 cents, a new low since devaluation in mid-September; the close was 88 cents, a loss...
docs.lead_paragraph: Almost all of the interest in the foreign exchange market last week centered in the slowly ebbing value of the Canadian free dollar which on Friday sold down to 87.82 cents, a new low since devaluation in mid-September; the close was 88 cents, a loss of 1 1/8 cents from the previous week. Monday's rate was 89.25 cents.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Dec. 9, 1949

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, Dec. 12 -- On the basis of a country-by-country survey of child-welfare conditions abroad, the United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund reported today that its relief programs were reaching about 10 per cent of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, Dec. 12 -- On the basis of a country-by-country survey of child-welfare conditions abroad, the United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund reported today that its relief programs were reaching about 10 per cent of the 60,000,000 undernourished youngsters considered to be in "urgent need of help."
docs.abstract: NY Times survey shows aid reaches 10% of children in need; various countries rept on plight; feeding and other programs in different areas described

headline.main: U. N. CHILDREN'S AID COVERS 10% OF NEED; Emergency Fund Survey Finds Relief Reaches Only Few of Estimated 60,000,000

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 13 (AP) -- Atilio Cattaneo, wanted by Argentine police on a charge that he insulted President Juan D. Peron, went into exile today in Uruguay.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 13 (AP) -- Atilio Cattaneo, wanted by Argentine police on a charge that he insulted President Juan D. Peron, went into exile today in Uruguay.
